bropals.lib.simplegame.entity.controls

Class TopDownEntityController

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.controls.Controller
      • bropals.lib.simplegame.entity.controls.EntityController
        • bropals.lib.simplegame.entity.controls.TopDownEntityController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, MouseListener

    public class TopDownEntityController
extends EntityController
    Associate with an Entity to have them be controlled in a top-down fashion. Moving up, down, left, and right causes the entity to get velocity in the direction that is being held.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TopDownEntityController(BlockEntity controlling, float speed)
      Creates a controller that controls an entity with WASD.
      TopDownEntityController(int keyUp, int keyDown, int keyLeft, int keyRight, BlockEntity controlling, float speed)
      Creates a controller that controls an entity with the specified keys.

        keyUp - the "move up" key.
        keyDown - the "move down" key.
        keyLeft - the "move left" key.
        keyRight - the "move right" key.
        controlling - the entity to control.
        speed - the movement speed of the controlled entity.

      • key

        public void key(int keycode,
                boolean pressed)
        Description copied from interface: KeyListener
        Called when the game gets key input.
        Parameters:
        keycode - the key code. Use KeyCode
        pressed - whether or not the key was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.

      • mouse

        public void mouse(int mousebutton,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  boolean pressed)
        Description copied from interface: MouseListener
        Called when the game gets mouse button input.
        Parameters:
        mousebutton - the mouse button. Use MouseButton
        x - the x position the mouse pressed
        y - the y position the mouse pressed
        pressed - whether or not the mouse button was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.
